feature_meanin: Longitude of the crash.
Latitude of the crash.
ID for the crash.
Year of the crash (yyyy).
Single letter indication crash severity.
possible_values: N: non-injury. M: minor. S:serious. F: fatal

feature_meanin: Number of fatalities for crash of severity F.
Number of seriously injured people.
Number of minor injured people.
Type of crash depending on amount and type of vehicles (and pedestrians) involved.
possible_values: Multi vehicle. Single vehicle. Vehicle(s)+Pedestrian(s). Vehicle(s)+Cyclist(s) only. Cyclists only. Vehicle(s)+multiple other types. Cyclist(s)+Pedestrian(s) only. Other. Others without non-parked veh

feature_meanin: Indicates whether the crash happened during a hilliday and which one.
possible_values: None. Christmas/New Year. Easter. Queens Birthday. Labour Weekend

feature_meanin: Indicated the geographical (and political) region where the crash happened.
possible_values: Auckland. Waikato. Canterbury. Wellington. Bay of Plenty. Otago. Manawatu/Wanganui. Northland. Hawkes Bay. Nelson/Marlborough. Southland. Taranaki. Gisborne. West Coast

feature_meanin: Indicates the local authority who handled the crash. Each region has several TLA.
possible_values: Several valuesper region. For example, Auckland has two TLA: Auckland and Waikato District. While Northland has three TLA: Whangarei District; Kaipara District and Far North District

feature_meanin: Indicate if a crash happened at an 'Intersection', 'At Landmark' or 'Unknown'.
The type of junction the crash happened at. Possible road junctions include . The junction type may also be unknown. Crashes that did not occur at a junction are also given a value of unknown.
possible_values: ÔDrivewayÕ, ÔRoundaboutÕ, ÔX Type JunctionÕ, 'T Type Junction', 'Y Type Junction', or 'Multi Road Join', 'unknown'

feature_meanin: Indicates whether the principal vehicle in a crash was on the crash road or side road at the time of the crash. Note that 'on side road' can only happen if the crash occurred at an intersection. Note that the feature has its name mispelled. Nevertheless, this is of no consequence.
The direction (dirn) of the principal vehicle involved in the crash.
Indicates where a crash is reported to have occurred on a State Highway.
The State Highway on which a crash occurred.
Derived feature to indicate if a crash occured at an intersection or not. It is calculated using the 'intersection' and 'junction_type' features.
Whether the road is fat or sloped.
The general nature of the road.
The curvature of the road.
The lane confguration of the road.
possible_values: 1': one way, '2': two way, 'M': for where a median exists, 'O': for off-road lane confguations, ' ': for unknown or invalid confguarations

feature_meanin: The road markings at the crash site.
possible_values: 'Ped Crossing', 'Raised Island', 'Painted Island', 'No Passing Lanes', 'Centre Line', 'No Marks', 'Unknown'

feature_meanin: The road surface description applying at the crash site.
The road wetness at the time and place of the crash.
The number of lanes on the crash road.
The traffc control signals at the crash site.
The speed limit in force at the crash site at the time of the crash.
The advisory speed at the crash site at the time of the crash.
The temporary speed limit at the crash site if one exists (e.g. for road works).
Derived feature using the 'speedLimit' feature.
Derived feature from the 'light' feature.
The light at the time and place of the crash.
The street lighting at the time of the crash.
Indicates weather at the crash time/place.
2nd level of detail for the weather at the crash time/place when applicable.
Derived feature to indicate how many times an Animal was struck in the crash. This is used where the animals, being driven or led, were under control.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a bridge, tunnel, the abutments, handrails were struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a cliff or bank was struck in the crash. This includes retaining walls
Derived feature to indicate how many times debris, boulders or items dropped or thrown from a vehicle(s) were struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a ditch or waterable drainage channel was struck in a crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a fence was struck in the crash. This includes letterbox(es), hoardings, private roadside furniture, hedges, sight rails, etc.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a guard or guard rail was struck in the crash. This includes 'New Jersey' barriers, 'ARMCO', sand filled barriers, wire catch fences, etc.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a houses, garages, sheds or other buildings were struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a kerb was struck in the crash, that contributed directly to the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times objects were thrown at or dropped on vehicles in the crash.

Derived feature to indicate how many times an object was struck in a crash and the object struck was not pre-defined. This feature includes stockpiled materials, rubbish bins, fallen poles, fallen trees, etc.
Derived feature to indicate how many times an embankment was struck or driven over during a crash. This feature includes other vertical drops driven over during a crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a parked or unattended vehicle was struck in the crash. This feature can include trailers.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a telephone kiosk traffic signal controllers, bus shelters or other public furniture was struck in the crash.

Derived feature to indicate how many times a post or pole was struck in the crash. This includes light, power, phone, utility poles and objects practically forming part of a pole (i.e. 'Transformer Guy' wires).
Derived feature to indicate how many times an object associated with roadworks (including signs, cones, drums, barriers, but not roadwork vehicles) was struck during the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times landslips, washouts or floods (excluding rivers) were objects struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a stray animal(s) was struck in the crash. This feature includes wild animals such as pigs, goats, deer, straying farm animals, house pets and birds.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a traffic island, medians (excluding barriers) was struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times traffic signage (including traffic signals, their poles, bollards or roadside delineators) was struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a train, rolling stock or jiggers was struck in the crash, whether stationary or moving.
Derived feature to indicate how many times trees or other growing items were struck during the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a stationary attended vehicle was struck in the crash. This includes broken down vehicles, workmen's vehicles, taxis, buses.
Derived feature to indicate how many times a body of water (including rivers, streams, lakes, the sea, tidal flates, canals, watercourses or swanps) was struck in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many bicycles were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many buses were involved in the crash (excluding school buses which are counted apart).
Derived feature to indicate how many cars or station wagons were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many mopeds were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many motorcycles were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many other vehicles (not included in any other category) were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many school buses were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many SUVs were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many taxis were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many trucks were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many vehicles were involved in the crash (where the vehicle type is unknown).
Derived feature to indicate how many vans or utes were involved in the crash.
Derived feature to indicate how many pedestrians were involved in the crash. This includes pedestrians on skateboards, scooters and wheelchairs.
